name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand upright holding dumbbells at sides.
Curl weights to shoulder keeping elbows stationary.
Lower under control to full extension.
ratingDesc: Classic bicep builder for all levels.

name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Hold dumbbells neutral (thumbs up) and curl to shoulder.
Lower slowly keeping wrist neutral.
Focus on controlled movement.
tips: Targets brachialis for bicep peak and thickness.
ratingDesc: Great for arm thickness and grip strength.

name: Tricep Rope Pushdown
instructions: Attach rope to high pulley and push down until arms locked.
Return slowly with control.
Keep elbows pinned to sides.
tips: Spread rope at bottom for full contraction.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
instructions: Grip bar narrower than shoulder width.
Lower to mid-chest then press up focusing on triceps.
Keep elbows tucked.
tips: Keep wrists straight and avoid flaring elbows.
ratingDesc: Effective for heavy triceps strength work.

name: Overhead Tricep Extension
instructions: Raise weight overhead and lower behind head with elbows pointed forward.
Extend arms overhead returning to start.
Keep elbows stable and close together.
tips: Use slow eccentric and avoid flaring elbows.
ratingDesc: Great for long head triceps development.

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit and curl single dumbbell with elbow braced on inner thigh.
Squeeze at top and lower slowly.
Focus on full contraction.
tips: Excellent for peak and mind-muscle connection.
ratingDesc: Isolated bicep finisher for detail work.

name: Reverse Curl
instructions: Curl with palms facing down to target forearms and brachialis.
Lower with controlled tempo.
Use moderate weight to avoid wrist strain.
tips: Great for grip and forearm size.
ratingDesc: Helpful accessory for grip and forearm strength.

name: Diamond Push-Up
instructions: Form hands in diamond shape under chest and perform push-ups.
Lower chest to hands and press up.
Keep core tight throughout.
tips: Good bodyweight triceps challenge with minimal equipment.
